results.title: Powers of ten
results.brief_description: An entirely new colour production of the Eamses “Rough sketch for a proposed film” (1968). Shows a linear view of our universe - first from the human scale to the sea of galaxies, then directly down to the nucleus of a carbon atom. With an image, a narration and a distance register it gives a clue to the relative size of things.

results.title: Powerlines for electricity
results.brief_description: Cable making industry in Australia. From the raw materials of copper , lead , aluminium, rubber and plastic we follow the process to the finished products. Shows the light flexible cable for domestic use as telephone and ironing cords; and heavy cables used in elevators, and mobile cranes; finishes with the making and laying of the co-axial cable which now links the telecommunications systems between Melbourne, Canberra and Sydney.

results.title: Power train
results.creator_credit: George Dunning, Films/West, Industrial Animation Films and Teru Murakami
results.brief_description: This animated program explains the workings of the automotive transmission system. Reveals the need for and the mechanics of each major component: clutch, gearbox, universal joint, drive shaft and differential.

results.title: Power to the people
results.creator_credit: Claire Taplin and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
The way people live now calls for constantly increasing supplies of energy for more and more power production. However, resources of fossil fuels are limited and the power they generates is a major source of pollution. Here is examined the environmental impact of atomic energy: radiation safety, thermal pollution, and disposal of nuclear wastes.

results.title: Power to serve
results.creator_credit: Athos Film Productions and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: The significance of power as a servant of the British industrial community. Explains how scientific understanding and technological skills are utilised and deployed in the manufacture of different power units; concentrates on engines and hows something of the research and testing undertaken before quantity production can commence.
